Reviews.Title: “Great value, no problems with our stay, but nothing super special”
Reviews.Author: Danielle D
Reviews.Content: If this hotel looks and feels like a Ramada Inn that did a time warp from the 80s, that's because that's what it is (we saw the word Ramada covered up in a few places!). But, the rooms are huge, and the bathroom was really nicely done-- reminded me of a bathhouse. All the rooms we saw were nonsmoking, but I think someone was smoking and it came through the vents as we could smell a bit of cigarette in our room. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and so was the night bartender. The breakfast was delicious with a great selection. The location is strange, but not inconvenient. It's not on the island part of Venice, but on the mainland with the airport. It feels like it is in the middle of nowhere but it's right by the bridge to Venice proper. It's a 5 minute walk (no sidewalks-- only one crosswalk that involves stairs) to the bus station and about 20 minutes by bus to the main station on the island. Invest in an all-in-one bus/water taxi pass, unless you feel like freeloading on the honor system. The area is quite desolate and quiet and night, which could be creepy if you are walking back by yourself. But, we thought this area was probably much easier to find/return to than to try to navigate the back roads of the island. Our only real dislike was that WiFi is only available in the lobby, and you must purchase 3 hours worth. We ended up scrounging for open wifi on the island because we were never around the hotel long enough to use 3 hours. Overall, this hotel is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: lth1031NewYork
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice in Mid-March of 2012. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I had a lovely spacious room on the 5th floor (room 505). First of all, it's not situated in the central area of Venice, where the grand canal passes through. In fact, when I took my train ride from Florence to Venice, this was the 2nd to last stop on the train. I got off at Venice-Meastre (I may have spelled this wrong) station. The hotel is located in the outskirts of central Venice. When I got out of the train station, I took the #9 bus to get to the hotel. Note, it may be a good idea to go to one of those Tachbacci shops to buy a bus ticket or bus card. The cards give you unlimited rides on the buses and the water buses in venice. I got the 72 hour card, and for an extra 3 euros more, it also covers transcport on the buses that go to the airport. Make sure to ask the clerk for details before buying the card; it appears different cards have different prices. The bus stop for the hotel is S. Orlanda (and then it's about another 10 min. walk to the hotel). The bus ride is about 15-20 minutes. Be careful because it is a highway you're walking through to get to the hotel. If you have large luggages, be extra cautious. After checking in, you can take bus #5 to Venice. Bus #5 also takes you to the airport. All rides are about 10-20 minutes, so nothing is too far. I liked the hotel. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. I had a flat screen TV with many TV channels. The bathroom was nice, with good water pressure. I had free breakfast in the morning. The hot food served were eggs, bacon, stuffed tomatoes, and sausages. There was also different cereals, yogurt, bread and sweet pastries, as well as fresh fruit. A pretty good selection of things. There was also coffee, tea and juice. Staff was friendly enough, but there was one guy who was really snotty. When I asked him questions, he answered in a very jerky way (made me want to smack him), but everyone else was ok. Also, when I left, there was additional tax that I had to pay that's separate from the fee for the room, and this was to be paid in cash. Location for hotel is inconvenient if you're looking to stay in city central. If you don't mind the 30 minute commute back to the hotel, I would recommend this place b/c it's inexpensive and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: sugarsmack11
Reviews.Content: What a weird place! Feels like it is in the middle of nowhere and maybe was abandoned for a few years. The decor is 80's. The rooms were large though. If you don't have a car, getting to Venice is a public bus ride over the bridge. The bus stop, even though some what close to the hotel, involves a walk along side a highway with no sidewalk. Not for the faint of heart! Also it seems to be in a very sketchy area. There was a prostitute hanging around at night. Maybe skip this place if you're staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “ok for one night, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_Norway
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, not so friendly staff, no Wifi in the room, only in the reception area( cost 2-3 euro for 1 hour) Food at the hotel, has low quality, breakfast was served to you( I like to find what I'm going to eat my self) Rooms was not so very clean, but they had smoking room( Phu) But if you want to see Venice, then book a room at the island. Cost 20 Euro just to drive the 4min from the hotel to the Island. Taxi in Italy is too expensive...... Been there, done that, not comming back

Reviews.Title: “Not for the general tourist”
Reviews.Author: JohnBSB
Reviews.Content: This hotel apparently caters to a lot of tour groups and as such it's in the OK range. The room was decent but the breakfast buffet was one of the poorest I had during my trip. On arrival there were no porters to help with luggage and the internet was not working. If you are with a tour group you might stay here, but if you have a choice, this would not be my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “More a 3 - star rather than a 4 - star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marianojohntan
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is along a highway and outside the city center of Mestre and Venice. But the hotel is adjacent to a nice park. The hotel's interior feels tired and needs updating. Rooms are average sized and the bathroom amenities are sparse and very basic. The front desk staff were quite helpful. Felt more like a 3 - star hotel than a 4 - star one. Good breakfast buffet. The downside to my family's two night stay was when we had dinner at the hotel's La Fontanella restaurant. The food was okay. But the evening restaurant manager that time, a Mr. Raoul, and one of his waiters (tall, balding and bearded) were kind of arrogant. We felt that they were condescending and were not too happy serving us. Is it because we're foreigners / Asians? We had to wait 15 - 20 minutes for our bill (even if the restaurant wan't full) and I even had to go to the manager to demand for it. It's just sad that there are still people who discriminate against others.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like we were scammed”
Reviews.Author: Sheri41k
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice enough - generally clean and rooms were larger than average. We booked the hotel through the kiosk at the Venice terminal. We paid a deposit and were provided a contract that listed the total cost of the rooms. Upon our arrival we were told that a mistake was made and the rooms were actually $20 euro higher. Even though we had the contract the choice was either pay or loss the deposit. We had been told that no family rooms were available but when we went to the rooms we discovered the sofa was a fold out and could accomandate our children. When we requested to ahve only the one room we were told that Italy las did not allow 4 adults in one room. Our children are 13 and 10 - since when has a 10 yr old been considered an adult! Feel like they took advantage of us and would caution any families to not trust them.

Reviews.Title: “Would you recommend this hotel to a friend?”
Reviews.Author: Mustaine2011
Reviews.Content: Spent here 4 nights during 2011 Venice Carnival Positive: - the staff, very friendly and willing to help - location is very good in San Giuliano 5 min walking to bus station, but access to the station is with risk (see negative) - I saw a big parking in the front of the hotel. I presume is free. I did not used a car during my stay, but I put parking as a plus - breakfast. I'm putting this as positive. not an exceptional one, but I saw much worst Negative: - no Internet in the room; if you want is extra cost (5 eur/2 hours) and the only access point is the hotel lobby; for me to stay in the lobby was not convenient, so it is a minus - I think this hotel is from 1970. except the LCD TV everything else starting with furniture,bathroom and ending with elevator I think are from 1970. I like history and museums, but only to visit not to live in :( - no pedestrian area to access the bus station. You have to walk 200 m on the right side of the highway to access the bus station; kind of risky in my opinion - it is classified as 4 stars, but I think 3 starts is the correct classification Now generalities about this hotel. Location: San Giuliano. This is a small village in mainland near the Venice. Taking in consideration the price of the hotels from the heart of Venice the option to be located on the mainland should be taking into consideration. Easy access with bus no.5 and no.19. It takes 15 min from Piaza Roma to the hotel's bus station which I may say is very reasonable as time Timetables for 5 and 19: http://www.actv.it/pdf/urbano/U-5.pdf http://www.actv.it/pdf/urbano/U-19.pdf No 5 is also the connection of the hotel to the airport The public transport Venice company is called ACTV. They are operating both land and water. Prices are here: http://www.actv.it/en/movinginvenice/movinginvenice I have bought on arrival in airport one 72h pass using the ACTV machine located there which accepted my credit card. From airport to hotel = 30 min About the buses.... They are not stopping to the bus station unless you wave your hand to them when approaching. Also if you are inside the bus they are not stopping to the next station unless you press the button which rings a bell to driver to aware him to stop So, to answer to the question:"Would you recommend this hotel to a friend? " I may say yes because I am a reasonable tourist. But for others this could be a negative experience. My final note is 2.5/5 which means average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! Would go again FOR SURE”
Reviews.Author: rah4585
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Venice this weekend for 2 days/1 night with our 2 babies (2 1/2 and 6 months). We drove it, the hotel was very easy to get to. Our room was very clean and the staff was very accommodating. The biggest PRO's are: FREE PARKING, FREE BREAKFAST (which was delicious), and FREE BUS that brings you right into downtown Venice (Piazzale Roma). It was a short walk to the bus stop (through a park and over a bridge. The entire experience was very pleasant, and I would recommend staying there to anyone. Our entire trip including gas, hotel, food, tolls and everything else was just under 300 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, But Probably Not For Everyone...”
Reviews.Author: incuerpo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a good distance from both airport & Venice itself. Cab ride was 25 Euros, a fair price for two. Easy check in, and good access to rooms. Yes, the decor throughout is dated, and it has the feel of somewhere in need of a bit of TLC, but for an affordable hotel in a "just out of town" location you cna't do much wrong. It's not a 5-star place so don't expect it. Breakfast was fine, fair selection of juices, cold plates, and some hot food for those who want a hearty start to the day. The rooms are OK, though they don't have any tea/coffee facilities, and make sure you ask at reception for an extra pillow as you only get one and it's very thin. Bus is 10 minutes to town and cost 1.80 euros. All in all, fair hotel, with decent facilities, but don't book here expecting the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovesa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and friends for one night on the way to pick up a cruise in Venice. The hotel stands on a very busy main road on the way from the airport to the centre of venice. Not the prettiest hotel I've ever stayed in - very 1960's! The receptionist was very helpful and told us how to get into venice etc. We decided to catch a bus but had to walk quite a way along a busy road to get to a bridge which took us to the bus stop. WEAR INSECT REPELLENT if you do this as the mossies were out in force when we we there. The room are quite spacious with everything you need but quite old fashioned. In the corridors the carpet goes up the walls - strange! The breakfast wasn't very nice. The fruit juices weren't real-- more like powdered and the bacon and sausage I found inedible. The beds were very comfortable and the staff courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Molokov
Reviews.Content: Our tour group stayed here for two nights. The rooms are a generous size, and facilities are good (and the bar is pretty nice, all it needs is a swimming pool). However, it is quite far from central Venice, but catching the bus there doesn't take too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice moderately priced hotel near Venice”
Reviews.Author: USAtouristcom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not great or fancy, but it does provide reasonably priced accommodations very near to Venice. The hotel is located near the intersection of two rather busy roads. Walking or jogging along these streets would be rather dangerous. Fortunately, there is a rather large park within a hundred meters and a long pedestrian bridge across the intersection. The bus stops only a few blocks away, and an inexpensive ten minute ride takes you to the Piazzola Roma on the outskirsts of old Venice. From there, you can take the water taxi or can walk into the historic center of the city. The rooms were spacious and clean but minimal. The hotel caters to business travelers and convention participants. Breakfast was also minimal but certainly adequate. They did provide free parking, and Internet access for a small fee. If you are looking for modestly priced accommodations with easy access into Venice, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “New Year at Venice”
Reviews.Author: Arxana
Reviews.Content: A sweet smile welcomed us at the reception....They were the most helpful people we could ever get..They were our guide....The rooms were large and amazing...The bathroom was big too.The breakfast served everyday had a huge variety and options.Loved everything here.......A must stay place......

Reviews.Title: “La bellissima Venezia”
Reviews.Author: MilosP
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel is near park San Giuliano. It's 6 km from historic center of Venice, just after the Bridge of Liberty (Ponte della Liberta), which connects Venice with the city of Mestre, on the land. It's only one stop by public transport, buses number 12 and 5. You need 10 minutes to arrive at Piazza Roma in Venice. And then you can go further to explore.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edu_8
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I stayed here with a tour group and was also robbed on the first night like the earlier review... A number of rooms of the people from our group were broken into on the first few hours of arrival whilst we were at dinner (for no more than 1hr) with no signs of forced entry and our bags searched and put back in place to show no signs of theft, no one wouldn't have noticed until one person in our tour group noticed missing items and alerted the rest of the group to do the same. After the theft was reported to staff little assistance was provided with neither the hotel staff or police willing to even look or inspect the rooms.. Then to show the 'quality' of the staff they would not even drive a group of us who got robbed to the police station which was less than 4km's away at most on there so called 'courtesy' bus instead they called a taxi for us who charged us EURO100 to travel those 4km's and the cab driver had the nerve to feed us a false story of how the police won't write a report unless we have a solicitor with us and out of convenience he happened to know someone who he gave us a business card of and contacted aswell... OH MAY I ADD HE DIDN'T EVEN TAKE US ALL THE WAY TO THE POLICE STATION HE DROPPED US OFF A KILOMETRE AWAY FROM THE POLICE STATION STILL! To add insult to injury the hotel has no Camera's and no alarms on the Emergency door so the thieves would have had a clean run into the hotel. As for staff they were pretty much useless as we requested a statement of the theft from the Hotel Manager to go with our Police Report and had to argue tooth and nail before he wrote something so basic as this was required by each of our travel insurers to make the claims on very odd thefts... MY FINAL WORDS FOR ANYONE CONSIDERING TO STAY HERE IS PAY A LITTLE EXTRA AND STAY ELSEWHERE AS THIS PLACE IS VERY DODGY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mdm_Belle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it was called Ramada Venice. There were holes is the curtain and permanent strains on the bathroom counter. Please avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a little far from town”
Reviews.Author: DaveInWestOz
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to take a short bus trip and walk/ferry to and from Venice then this is a great place to stay. Very helpful staff, large, clean and modern rooms and nice bar area all make for a pretty good hotel. The only negative for me was the location. Would recommend it none-the-less.

Reviews.Title: “In General good experience”
Reviews.Author: AthensStelios
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for one night during our tour in Italy. Even though we reached very late at night we face no problem with the rooms. If i had to give points with the best level 10, i will seperate my bonus in the next levels: Clean Room: 10 Clean Hotel: 9 Breakfast (variety): 6 (Small buffet without serving not even Espresso) The staff with kind way avoided our request for extra pillows or extra towels. In general we stayed happy but we will not prefer it again because in the same price we found same quality hotels inside the town and not 10 minutes away

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: cult1
Reviews.Content: The room was marvelous.The stuff friendly enough and the prepaid suppper very interesting.The only minus was the breakfast(very very poor with bad quality for a 4 star hotel).If the breakfast was good enough tha grade would be a A+.

Reviews.Title: “A little far from the Mestre train station.”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_CH1700
Reviews.Content: == Arrival == This hotel is at the center of nothing. If you arrive Venice Mestre by train, you have to spend some 18 Euros to take a taxi. Of course there is a bus stop near the hotel (500 meters). The problem is, the bus no.5, which connects the airport, the hotel and the main island, doesn't go to the Mestre train station. The best way (and possible the only way) to go to the hotel from the train station is to take a taxi. == Going to the island == It is easy to go to the main island of Venice from the hotel. The bus stop is just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Both bus no.5 or 19 take you to the island in just 10 minutes. == Room == Rooms are old fashioned but quite clean. If possible, avoid those rooms which are located near the lifts. The two lifts are noisy, especially during the night. == Environment == Nothing but lawn and a highway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: In my point of view, the advantage of the hotel is that it is out of the down town, but quite close to it. There is a shuttle bus, which departs to the central bus station of Venice every 30 minutes. From the window of the room we stayed we could see the city and a park. Our room was quite spacious and clean. There was a wide selection of food and beverages in breakfast and the restaurant offered delicious meal and wines. If we are back to Venice, weâ€™ll stay in Russot hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnr_gt
Reviews.Content: We would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Please stay away from this hotel. Especially if you are from USA it is very hard to travel to and from this hotel. I stayed with my family of four here recently for 3 nights. It is in the middle of no where, if you don't have a car, you have to depend on taxi or bus to get to this hotel, it is very expensive. 20 Euros from Mestre Railway station. P. Roma is 10 mins. away. Hotel didn't had bus tickets. They charge you 5 Euros to use their shuttle each way to P. Roma, which you have to reserve in way advance. Lot of musquitos in the room. Yes musquitos. Hotel is very old, rooms are very SMELLY. Every other hotel in Venice gives free breakfast, except this hotel. Staff service is terrible, they are very ARROGANT. They charged me 60 Euros per night extra for my kids. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. Do yourself a favor spend little more money and stay on the istalnd. This is not worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: Russott Hotel Venezia San Giuliano
HotelInfo.Address: Via Orlanda 4, San Giuliano, 30173 Venice, Italy
